chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Stepp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Andrew M Stepp
parties.address: 707 Wisconsin Ave  Apt 1A, North Fond du Lac, WI 54937

parties.name: Green Lake County Clerk of Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Sentence is to commence immediately.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution - to be filed within 30 days and if not filed Court will assume that no restitution is due.  If filed Court allows 30 days for the defendant to accept or object to the amount and a restitution hearing can be scheduled.  Restitution filed 10/28/2016 in the amount of $6,980.94.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises licensed to sell alcohol by the drink.
-No contact with the victim.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Return / Destruction of Original Exhibits
State's Exhibit #1

11:21 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from New Lisbon Correctional with Atty Barb Privat in court.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - is ready to proceed.  Statement by DA Christenson - restitution is:  $8,246.74.

David Hoppa sworn, direct by DA Christenson, is owner of truck that was stolen.  Testimony given.  DA offers exhibit 1 - estimate for damages to truck.  No objection by Atty Privat.  Court receives exhibit #1.  Cross exam by Atty Privat.  Re-direct by DA Christenson.  Court questions witness.

Statement by DA Christenson - waives argument and requests the court order restitution.  Argument by Atty Privat.  Statement by defendant.

Court orders restitution in the amount of $6,980.94.  In regards to the $1200 loss of the use of the truck - victim is not entitled to that amount.  Court orders the JOC to reflect the restitution of $6,980.94.

Court adjourned at 11:41 a.m.
Restitution hearing on June 28, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Restitution hearing on June 19, 2017 at 08:30 am.
By Atty Barb Privat

2:32 p.m. Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - is still contesting the restitution hearing.  Court goes over right to counsel and how to obtain counsel.  Statement by defendant - is requesting an attorney.  Further statement by defendant.  Court will set for internal review in 30 days for counsel to be appointed.  Defendant can appear via video.

Court adjourned at 2:36 p.m.
Restitution hearing on March 20, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

10:43 a.m.  Defendant present in court via video and telephone from New Lisbon Correctional Institution and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - disagrees with the amount of the restitution and was not aware of the restitution until January.  Court notes summary of restitution was filed on October 28, 2016.  DA has no objection to hold a restitution hearing.  Court grants the request to hold a restitution hearing and defendant will be via video.

Court adjourned at 10:47 a.m.
/Request to Change 02-27-2017 Hearing to a Video Hearing or Phone Hearing
from Atty Barb Privat dated February 10, 2017 re: restitution
from the defendant dated February 3, 2017 - requests to appear via video for the 02/27 hearing
Hearing on February 27, 2017 at 10:30 am.
Request for Restitution Hearing Pursuant to SS973.20. Objection to Restitution.  Defendant was not advised of Restitution Request Being Filed. (Defendant's)

records.addlTxt:
10:25 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, states one correction, with no additions or deletions.  Statement by Bonnie Holden.

Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-2 years Initial Confinement and 3 years of Extended Supervison

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.  Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-Defendant is not to be on any premises licensed to sell alcohol by the drink.
-No contact with the victim
-Restitution - to be filed within 30 days and if not filed Court will assume that no restitution is due.  If filed Court allows 30 days fo rthe defendant to accept or object to the amount and a restitution hearing can be scheduled.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP program and eligible for the SAP program.

Consecutive to any other sentence.  Court orders sentence to commence immediately.

Court adjourned at 10:47 a.m.
By Atty Barbara Privat
to counsel with a copy of the presentence investigation report
Sentencing hearing on October 4, 2016 at 10:00 am.
from Atty Barb Privat - requests the 08/02 sentencing date be rescheduled approx 60 days
Fond du lac County Jail - 08/02/2016 at 9:00 a.m. (PSI Sentencing)
Sentencing hearing on August 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.

11:35 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea NC to the charge with no repeater and counsel will request a PSI.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and strikes the repeater.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a PSI be completed and filed with the court within 60 days.  Upon filing, copies are to be disbursed to counsel.  Court sets for Sentencing on August 2, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:40 a.m.

Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 10, 2016 at 11:30 A.M.

By Atty Barb Privat

Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
